Course Description: The theory of rational choice permeates every discipline that touches upon human behavior. This course provides foundations for rational decision making in certain and uncertain environments. Various representation theorems are discussed and the associated decision rules are illustrated in applications.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students are able to understand the foundations for decision making under subjective uncertainty.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students are able to understand the foundations for decision making under objective uncertainty.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students are able to use the rational choice theories in substantive applications like insurance and portfolio choice.
Students are able to use the rational choice theories in substantive applications like insurance and portfolio choice.
Students are able to appreciate some statistical procedures as applications of rational choice theory.
